content:
With card view what you see is what you get.

You might want to join the UX discussion on card view here https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/ux/Tdb49a4666565e68e/cards-view-ui-plans

I do not see any real user options planned, just more what you see is what you will accept stuff.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
there is a contact form for issues and questions about donations. It is not a topic for this Support forum where you are interacting with fellow users for support.

If you issue is not covered in the FAQ which is linked from the doanations page you might try using the contact link https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/help/

Personally I think your question as stated is fully answered in the FAQ.

Why do you need my address in order to process a gift? We understand that your privacy is very important. We ask for a minimum amount of information required to process credit card payments, including billing addresses. This allows our payment processor to verify your identity, process your payment, and prevent fraudulent charges to your credit card. We keep your information private â€” if you have questions, please refer to our Privacy Policy. If you would rather not fill in your information on our online form, you can mail us a check.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
THanks Matt.

your reply set me on the right path - I went to the "View" menu, and found that the "Density" sub-menu choice had been switched to "Compact" when I downloaded the new version (115.3)

Checking, instead, "Default" made the message list more readable, and increasing the Font size, as you noted, also helped
creator: gfwtgfwt

content:
If you were talking about a dozen eggs and you got 5 broken ones and the seller refused to help with that I would agree with you. Despite popular ideas to the contrary computers remain highly technical tools and are not even now in the same category as an old DVD player that you can expect to "just work". Despite the fact they often did not with the new Disney releases. Interestingly the advances in monitor sizes and hence the size of pixels (which is the basis of Thunderbird scaling) means that occasionally the software gets it wrong. This is not really to be unexpected when it required a cooperative interaction between Thunderbird, the operating system and a video driver usually written by the video card manufacturer to work flawlessly.

I am guessing you got an update and your font is apparently smaller. Where I do not know, because you forgot to mention that part, so I will guess it is in the message lists and folder names.

Go to the View menu (in V102). Click on the plus sign on that menu Go to the menu and click on the plus sign beside the word Font (in V115)
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Well perhaps click on the three dots at the top of your image beside the new message and ensure only the all folders view is selected. That image looks to me like both the unified view and the all folders view are both enabled.
creator: MattAuSupport
